episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of fascinating topics, including the longevity of bowhead whales, the extreme sound system of the European Space Agency, the use of facial recognition technology for chickens, and the potential dangers of loud noises. The hosts also delve into historical anecdotes about coffee bans and the peculiarities of Elvis impersonators.

facts.fact: There are whales alive today who were alive before Moby Dick was written.
The European Space Agency has a sound system so loud that if you heard it, it would kill you.
Facial recognition technology for chickens allows you to pre-order a specific chicken and watch it grow on the farm before it ends up on your plate.
In the 18th century, Sweden banned coffee and conducted experiments on prisoners to test its health effects.
